Key Arguments: Risk of censorship and government overreach.
Chilling effect on speech leading to self-censorship.
Potential for abuse targeting political opponents or minority viewpoints.
Technological and practical challenges in implementation.
Potential conflict with international human rights standards.
Alternative solutions like education and media literacy.
Notable Quotes: Such a bill might infringe on the fundamental right to freedom of speech.
Determining what constitutes misinformation or disinformation can be subjective.
The bill could lead to overreach by government or regulatory authorities.
This chilling effect could hinder robust public discourse and lead to self-censorship.
A potential unintended consequence might be the hindering of investigative journalism or whistleblowing activities.
